result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Maura McMahon advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Corrected Order on Competency correcting the name of the Facility to Precious Minds AFH LLC so the jail can release the defendant today to the facility.  Signed by Judge Paul F Reilly September 7, 2022.
Filed by Atty. Bosch, with Waukesha County Corporation Counsel, re: defendant's placement.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: 3:30 PM; Case called for Review hearing.  Attorney Michael Thurston in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Ryne F DAmico in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court for Ryne F DAmico.  Court notes there are also Family members present by Zoom video means for the hearing today.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.  Court notes the matter was set over for continued review hearing with respect to the competency findings.  Court inquire as to what the plan is going forward.  Atty. McMahon provides an update and notes as the defendant is already under a Chapter 55 Corporation Counsel will not be taking any additional action with respect to this matter.  Atty. McMahon outlines where the court can go from here.  Atty. Thurston confirms the information provided by Atty. McMahon and presents his recommendations to the Court and notes they are opposed to the defendant being released back in to the community.  Atty. McMahon presents additional statements.  Court agrees that release back into the community is not an option at this time.  Pursuant to the Court's prior finding that the defendant is not competent and not likely to become competent with treatment within the permissible timeframe the Court will order the defendant be placed/transferred to Mendota Mental Health Institution as soon as possible.  Court will order the defendant remain in the custody of the Waukesha County Jail until he can be transferred to Mendota.  Court will also order the proceedings be suspended.  Court will not conduct any annual review hearings at this time but will entertain any motion from Defense or the State to bring the matter back before the Court if needed.  Court will also sign the Order on Competency.
Proposed Order on Competency submitted by Atty. McMahon.
Review hearing on September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Review hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:19 PM; Case called for Review hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Kristy Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryne F DAmico in court.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court for Ryne F DAmico.  Court notes the matter is before the Court for review of the Competency evaluation.  Court confirms with counsel they have received and reviewed the competency report filed on 8/16/2022.  Atty. McMahon confirms she has received and reviewed the report with her client and they are not contesting the findings.  Atty. Gordon confirms she has received and reviewed the report and is not contesting the findings.  Court will find the defendant is not competent and not likely to become competent with treatment within the permissible timeframe.  Court inquires how the matter will proceed from here.

State advises they have reached out to Corporation Counsel to have this matter reviewed by their office, and are requesting another review hearing in about 2 weeks to allow time for Corporation Counsel to respond to them.  Atty. McMahon presents statements, she has no objection to the court setting a review hearing for status in about 2 weeks.  Court will order the defendant be held under 971.14 (6)(b) until the next hearing or further order of the Court.  Atty. McMahon notes the defendant would prefer to be sent to Mendota. Court has no objection to the defendant being sent to Mendota if a bed opens up.  Court will adjourn for continued review hearing and status.
Review hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Dated 08/16/2022 and filed by Dr. Jenna Niess.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Filed by Atty. McMahon.

Notice Regarding US Passport for Criminal Defendant

The original history event date is: 07-18-2022
Proposed competency order

ADDRESS INFO for Ryne F DAmico
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2022)
Prior: 2549 N Palmer St, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to have no contact with any child under the age of 18 or any schools.    Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 2 mile of Victim A or Victim A's family's residence, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.    Receipt of Passport surrendered to the Court within one business day.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

03:05 PM Defendant Ryne F DAmico in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Attorney Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an inpatient/outpatient basis within 30 days.  Review hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
